forEach iterates over each element in the arrayList, then Concat returns a new string. It does not change the original string in the arrayList.

Replaceall will replace the original string in the arrayList.

discussion.content:
The correct answer is the letter C and I will explain:
A -> Need to display the menu, the code doesn't have that. Besides, you can't read the variables in the increment of a for, if you want, it has to be done inside it.
B -> Wrong, the menu must be shown, if the input is 0 the menu is not even displayed and the application is terminated.
C -> It is correct, the menu appears and the data is read, if it is different from 0, the code continues.
D -> Wrong, while boolean expression accepts 0 as an answer to continue.
A is the correct answer. The only place where option is initialized
The correct answer is C.
The main problem of B and D is that 'option' is even not initialized, which cannot be compiled

comments.content: As said there in polyorphism but other 2 are implemented

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The answer is C. We make a polymorphism when we instantiate a variable of type "playable" referencing an object of type "Game", we have erance because the "Game" class inherits the methods of the "playable" interface and we have abstraction because by default any method of an interface is abstract, public and void, so we have abstraction as well.

choices.C: Polymorphism, inheritance, and abstraction are implemented.
choices.D: Only inheritance and encapsulation are implemented.
choices.A: Polymorphism, abstraction, and encapsulation are implemented.
choices.B: Only polymorphism and inheritance are implemented.

choices.B: The break statement, at the end of each case block, is optional.
choices.C: Its case label literals can be changed at runtime.
choices.D: Its expression must evaluate to a collection of values.
choices.A: It must contain the default section.
